name: Morning Commute
description: For people starting their work day, whether that's a commute to an office or a commute from bed to desk. The show acknowledges that mornings are not everyone's favorite time without being aggressively cheerful about it.

presenters.notes: Mostly duo for conversation, occasional solo for focused segments

tone.mood: Acknowledging that mornings happen, with light energy but no fake enthusiasm

check_ins: For everyone pretending they've read their emails
sample_lines: It's 7:30. Time to pretend you've read all your emails.
Shout out to everyone whose first meeting is at 9am. You have an hour and a half to mentally prepare.
The 7:42 to London is delayed. Shocking exactly no one.
That was 'Morning Coffee' requested by Sarah. Sarah, we hope the caffeine is kicking in.

handover.style: Transition from early morning to work day proper, acknowledging the shift in energy

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference darkness, cold commutes, reluctance to leave bed

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference light mornings, nicer weather, easier to get up

autumn.tone_adjustment: Back-to-school energy in September even though listeners aren't in school

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge holiday time, people having time off, reduced traffic

new_year.tone_adjustment: First work day of the year energy, back to normal

ai_budget.notes: 35% talk = 63 minutes = 3780 seconds of TTS maximum, 65% music = 117 minutes
